oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Domain Adaptation of Information Extraction Models
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GUPTA, R
SARAWAGI, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Domain adaptation refers to the process of adapting an extraction model trained in one domain to another related domain with only unlabeled data. We present a brief survey of existing methods of retraining models to best exploit labeled data from a related domain. These approaches that involve expensive model retraining are not practical when a large number of new domains have to be handled in an operational setting. We describe our approach for adapting record extraction models that exploits the regularity within a domain to jointly label records without retraining any model.
